Message.Title: New girl here... Can you help me?
Message.Msg: Hello, I'm really new to the stock market. It seems like there's a lot of people who know what they're doing with the stock market and Amazon's stock on this board. I'm happy I've found this place, I can learn tips from everyone! I love Amazon.. I buy tons of stuff from them. Do you think I should buy AMZN now? Oh, what's shorting, by the way? I see that word often on this board. Thanks! ~Jenni

Topic.Title: New girl here... Can you help me?

Message.Msg: Read the book Beating The Stock Market by R L McNeal. It was written 90 years ago and has withstood the test of time. Its available free on the internet. Or you can listen to my summary. Stocks are high right now. Wait for a big correction.

Topic.Title: New girl here... Can you help me?

Message.Msg: Hi Jennie, welcome to the board. It's not a good time to buy AMZN. I buy when its under $200 and sell when its over $200. It will likely drop under $220 within a month or 2, that's when you should buy. There's nothing wrong with sitting on cash waiting for a dip. By the way, most of the posters here are idiots, don't pay much attention to them!

Topic.Title: New girl here... Can you help me?

Message.Msg: "Do you think I should buy AMZN now?" Hello Jennie, Welcome to the exciting world of investing. It would help us answer your question better if you could tell us your approximate age and investment objective and horizon and how much you can afford to lose. If you're young and going for a long-term growth, I believe AMZN is a good stock to own. However, I'm not sure if now is the time to buy AMZN. AMZN may offer a better entry point (below last Friday's close: $257.47) in the near-future. A minor pull-back is quite possible and healthy. David

Topic.Title: The Hindenberg Factor

Message.Msg: Two years ago this turd was bouncing around the 140-110 level. Depending on when you got in it could have made a decent trade on the short side. The only patheticness I hear is coming from a future bagholder.

Topic.Title: The Hindenberg Factor
The Hindenberg Factor

Message.Msg: So, it sounds like you don't think JB knows what he's doing. He's 47 and he's made 20 billion. I don't think he's as dumb as you seem to.

Topic.Title: New girl here... Can you help me?

Message.Msg: "Don't try to time the market. You buy some here, if it goes down a lot you buy some more later." Been there, done that. Buying high almost always leads to panicking right at the bottom. BTW, buying low is NOT market timing. Market timing is trying to pick exact tops and bottoms, which is impossible to do or everyone would be doing it.

Topic.Title: The Hindenberg Factor

Message.Msg: The date stamping is too vague. I need an exact date, rather than, "somewhere around two years ago."

Message.Title: What I think will happen to AMZN stock price love hear your input
Message.Msg: I think they will take AMZN to between 205 to 215 pretty fast thus getting all kinds of shorts to jump on that are on but not as heavy as they want to be, or they want to short or buy puts but have not yet. After the mm's feel as many shorts are on as will happen, they will make sure 2 or 3 short aqueezes happen that sends AMZN over 300! Now the only thing wrong with this feeling is I too feel these kindle fires are chit and I can see things getting really bad and Bezos just totally blew it with this call, I feel 80 could happen or 60 if it gets as bad as amzn stuck with tons of kindles nobody bought that they were selling at a loss anyway because everyone adults and kids bought either a Samsung Galaxy s3 or Iphone 5, there just was not enough money out there in this awful real 25% unemployment economy for the s3 the iphone 5 and the kindle fire crap to do allright. The wildcard would be if he really can sell all these chitty things he thinks he can, in that case the bulls could take amzn to 350 400 with momentum and shock and suprise alone.

Message.Title: Amazon Sales TAX in CA and PA
Message.Msg: Amazon now has to collect sales tax in both CA and PA. I know people that sell high ticket items (TVs) for Amazon through their affiliate program and they have seen a big drop over the last couple of days. Could this be the result of the sales tax being added to two huge states like CA and PA? Are people still going to buy big ticket items from Amazon given the sales tax being added? What bothers me is that there are still a lot of smaller online retailers out there that are not paying sales tax in CA and PA that are putting Amazon at a huge disadvantage. Is Amazon addressing this?

Topic.Title: New girl here... Can you help me?

There's no way of knowing if it's going to go down more, right? People could always win, if that was the case. Thanks Edison for the good advice. One of my friends is named that, so it's easy to remember!

Topic.Title: New girl here... Can you help me?

Message.Msg: Hi Bruce and thanks for the welcome! (It's Jenni, though~ :-) ) Wow, if I wait for $220 that'll take some time... Amazon is really popular, all my friends buy from there and internet shopping is easy and fast. What if it's going up? ~Jenni

Topic.Title: New girl here... Can you help me?

Message.Msg: Patient is very important in the stock market. Amazon is one of the most overvalued stocks. Patient becomes more important. If you dream it can continue go high like no top. Then you will lose big moneny soon. I agree it is nothing wrong to keep cash, wait for good opportunity to buy.

Topic.Title: New girl here... Can you help me?

Message.Msg: AMZN can drop to $220 in one day. If it goes up and you didn't buy it means you haven't lost anything. To make money you have to buy at the right time and sell at the right time. AMZN is near its all time high. Now is the time to sell and bank some profit. Remember, no one ever went broke taking a profit. AMZN always hits new highs, but suppose you buy at 255 and it drops to 220. At that point some investors will get scared and sell. That's the opposite of what you should do. Be patient. When earnings are announced there is a good chance the stock will drop for a day. That is the time to buy. So have your money in your brokerage account so you'll be able to move fast.

Topic.Title: What I think will happen to AMZN stock price love hear your input

Message.Msg: I haven't seen the new Kindles yet, but the 7 inch Fire @ $200 looks interesting. The 9 inch models, although cheaper than an iPad, are too expensive for Amazons market. Amazon sells these devices at a loss, so profit is not their motive. Their main purpose is to highlight Amazon books and movies.

Message.Msg: I don't know much about T/A but I saw a daily and weekly chart posted at the NTWK board and it looks incredible!! The chart shows an uncanny resemblance (lower or weekly chart) to the 2010 rally when the stock went from $8 to $24 in 4 weeks. I hear that the company is stronger and more diversified now than in 2010. The company did not have the highly profitable cloud divisions in 2010. I will be buying with both hands tomorrow
